intro: Pseudabutilon weberbaueri, commonly known as the Weberbauer's pseudabutilon, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and open woodlands. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in ecological and taxonomic research.
